parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.68</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Strings </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Arrays </value></part><part><name>GROUP2</name>=<value>

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Converts given, formatted as simple array, [[String]] into a valid [[Array]]. Simple array is array consisting of [[Number]]s, [[String]]s, [[Boolean]]s and [[Array]]s of all of the above. For example: <tt>[1,"2",true,[4,"five",false]]</tt>. The string representation of this array compatible with [[parseSimpleArray]] will be <tt>"[1,""2"",true,[4,""five"",false]]"</tt> accordingly. This command is almost '''4x faster''' than similar uncached [[call]] [[compile]] method. And because [[call]] [[compile]] is not required, it is also '''more secure''' and primarily intended for use with [[callExtension]] to parse the [[String]] output into [[Array]]. Since Arma 3 v.1.95.145925 the command will tolerate extra spaces and supports single quotes. The only recognised keywords (case '''in'''sensitive) are:
* <tt>true</tt> - translates into [[true]]
* <tt>false</tt> - translates into [[false]]
* <tt>nil</tt> - translates into [[nil]]
* <tt>null</tt> - translates into [[nil]]
* <tt>&lt;null&gt;</tt> - translates into [[nil]]
* <tt>any</tt> - translates into [[nil]]
</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''parseSimpleArray''' stringArray</value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> stringArray: [[String]] - string formatted as simple array </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - valid array</value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value><code>_arr = [[parseSimpleArray]] "[1,2,3]";</code></value></part><part><name/>=<value>	  
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_bool = [[true]];
_num = 123.45;
_str = "ok";
_arr = [1,false,"cool"];
_res = [[parseSimpleArray]] [[format]] ["[%1,%2,%3,%4]", _bool, _num, [[str]] _str, [[str]] _arr]; 
// Note how _bool and _num do not need [[str]], however if used anyway, the result in this case would be identical
[[hint]] [[str]] _res; // [true,123.45,"ok",[1,false,"cool"]]</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[set]], [[resize]], [[pushBack]], [[pushBackUnique]], [[select]], [[apply]], [[reverse]], [[count]], [[find]], [[in]], [[forEach]], [[deleteAt]], [[deleteRange]], [[append]], [[sort]], [[arrayIntersect]], [[callExtension]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>
